com.samsung.android.sdk.composer

Class SpenWritingControl

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.samsung.android.sdk.composer.SpenWritingControl

  • public class SpenWritingControl
extends Object
    SpenWritingControl is a handwriting control class for the content which been focused. It provides the basic methods for retrieving or modifying object and object property in handwriting. The writing control could be easily retrieved from SpenComposerView.getWritingControl().
    Since:
    5.0.0

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  SpenWritingControl.TextSpanType
      The type of text span.

      String getSelectedText()
      Get the text that is selected in the text box control.
      void hideToolbar()
      Hide handwriting toolbar Only you use to be focused the ContentHandwriting.
      boolean isRedoable()
      Check if the action is redoable.
      Check if the redo stack in the history manager is empty.
      If it is empty, there is no command to redo, and the method returns false.
      If it is not empty, it returns true.
      Always use this method before calling Redo().
      boolean isUndoable()
      Check if the action is undoable.
      Check if the undo stack in the history manager is empty.
      If it is empty, there is no command to undo, and this method returns false.
      If it is not empty, it returns true.
      Always call this method before calling Undo().
      void redo()
      Updates the screen after executing redo command Only you use to be focused the ContentHandwriting.

      Remove the text in the text box control.

        Since:

      • closeControl

        public void closeControl()
        Close the native SpenControlBase instance. Call this method before destroying the instance to prevent memory leaks. Only you use to be focused the ContentHandwriting.
        Since:
        5.0.0

      • updateCanvas

        public void updateCanvas()
        Update the canvas. Call this method to update the view if you add/remove Objects. Only you use to be focused the ContentHandwriting.
        Since:
        5.0.0

      • appendText

        public void appendText(String str)
        Append the specified text to the text box control. Only you use to be focused the ContentHandwriting.
        Parameters:
        str - The text to add to the control.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - Thrown if str is null.
        Since:
        5.0.0

      • removeText

        public void removeText()
        Remove the text in the text box control. If there is selected text, it is deleted. Otherwise, the character at the current cursor position is deleted. Only you use to be focused the ContentHandwriting.
        Since:
        5.0.0

      • getSelectedText

        public String getSelectedText()
        Get the text that is selected in the text box control. Only you use to be focused the ContentHandwriting.
        Returns:
        The text in the text box control.
        Since:
        5.0.0

      • selectAllText

        public void selectAllText()
        Select all the text in the text box control. Only you use to be focused the ContentHandwriting.
        Since:
        5.0.0

      • canSelectAllText

        public boolean canSelectAllText()
        Check the text box can select all or not. Only you use to be focused the ContentHandwriting.
        Since:
        5.0.0

      • updateTextSettingInfo

        public void updateTextSettingInfo(SpenSettingTextInfo info,
                                  SpenWritingControl.TextSpanType type)
        Set the specified text settings information for the text box control. Only you use to be focused the ContentHandwriting.
        Parameters:
        info - The text settings information object.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - Thrown if info is null.
        Since:
        5.0.0

      • getDrawnRect

        public RectF getDrawnRect()
        Get the region that the rectangle takes up in the viewport. If an object got rectangle(1, 1, 2, 4) is rotated by 90 degrees using setRotate(90), rectangle is still (1, 1, 2, 4) but DrawnRect is (0, 2, 3, 3). Only you use to be focused the ContentHandwriting.
        Returns:
        The viewing object area.
        Since:
        5.0.0

      • stopActionMode

        public void stopActionMode()
        Finish and close this action mode.
        Since:
        5.0.0

      • appendTextObject

        public void appendTextObject(String str)
        Add the specified text object to the current page.
        The add object action is recorded in the history stack. Only you use to be focused the ContentHandwriting.
        Parameters:
        str - The text that you want to add.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - Thrown if str is null.
        Since:
        5.0.0

      • appendImageObject

        public void appendImageObject(String filePath)
        Add the specified image object to the current page.
        The add object action is recorded in the history stack. Only you use to be focused the ContentHandwriting.
        Parameters:
        filePath - The absolute path of the files that you want to add.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - Thrown if filePath is null.
        Since:
        5.0.0

      • isUndoable

        public boolean isUndoable()
        Check if the action is undoable.
        Check if the undo stack in the history manager is empty.
        If it is empty, there is no command to undo, and this method returns false.
        If it is not empty, it returns true.
        Always call this method before calling Undo(). Only you use to be focused the ContentHandwriting.
        Returns:
        true if the undo stack is not empty.
        false if the undo stack is empty.
        Since:
        5.0.0
        See Also:
        undo()

      • isRedoable

        public boolean isRedoable()
        Check if the action is redoable.
        Check if the redo stack in the history manager is empty.
        If it is empty, there is no command to redo, and the method returns false.
        If it is not empty, it returns true.
        Always use this method before calling Redo(). Only you use to be focused the ContentHandwriting.
        Returns:
        true if the redo stack is not empty.
        false if the redo stack is empty.
        Since:
        5.0.0
        See Also:
        redo()

      • getImageObjectCount

        public int getImageObjectCount()
